doc.repnme: Subscribing to monopoly : the telecom monopolist's lexicon (revisited)
doc.abstracts: Wasteful duplication of facilities, uneconomic entry, universal service, and cream skimming are the catchphrases used by many telecom executives, civil servants, and merchant bankers in arguing for continuing telecom monopolies and cross-subsidies. The author explains why their arguments are wrong.
